captions.text: Hey Vsauce I'm Jake and I'M ON FIRE.

Now that I'm dead let's explore my heart.
Body XQ Heart is an incredibly detailed look

at one of your most important organs. You
can see how a healthy heart functions or what

it looks like with a myriad of varying diseases.
The app also lets you explore the different

chambers and coronary artery. It gives you
an amazing look at how the heart actually
works. But give your heart a rest and take

A Ride Into the Mountains a beautiful and
challenging adventure game. You play as Zu,

a boy who goes off on horseback with only
his bow and arrow to protect a relic. On your

journey you have to battle different kinds
of creatures and avoid their attacks. Some

have protective shields that only a well placed
shot can break through, and others manipulate

the wind changing the directions of your shots.
As the game progresses the fights start to

feel more and more like puzzles as you figure
out where and when to fire your bow. All that

riding probably has you thirsty, good thing
there's

Super Juice Master 5000. The premise is simple,
humanity has been enslaved and the only thing

keeping us from being destroyed is your ability
to make delicious and nutritious juice. You

are in control of a giant juice crusher and
you have to pulverize fruit whilst avoiding

non-juicable items like fire extinguishers
and cell phones. There are multiple different

power-ups like ones that slow down time or
others that create flowing fruit portals.

This game is probably the best futuristic
alien juice simulator I have ever played,

which is saying...something...but you don't
wanna just be a cog in the corporate alien
juice world, no you could be the

Middle Manager of Justice. Made by Double
Fine, this sim game finds you hiring, managing

and training Superheroes. The more villains
you dispatch and office work you complete,

the more money you get to upgrade your facilities
and build new departments. The heroes can

level up to become stronger, smarter, have
increased health and they can even get promotions.

As their manager you schedule battles for
them, manage inventory and deal with motivating

your employees. To keep moving up the corporate
ladder, learn something new with

Khan Academy, a great tool for studying or
discovering educational topics. They have

a great YouTube channel as well, but the app
lets you download the over 4200 videos so

you can watch them whenever. It also has the
ability to track your progress and neatly

categorizes the different lessons from maths,
sciences to projects you can do yourself.

I usually end up watching a video every night
as I sit alone and eat dinner. Then I ride
on a river made of my tears in

Riptide GP2, an amazingly fun racing game.
There are tons of different tracks and modes

to compete on, like ones that slowly eliminate
each player in last position, speed runs and

good ol' classic races. The more you win the
better you can upgrade your hydro-jet or purchase

a completely new one. You also gain experience
points to use towards unlocking new tricks.

*check me out ladies* Not only does the game
have awesome graphics and nice touches like

water splashing onto the camera, but it also
has a great multiplayer mode. I am currently

racing against my friend Elly Awesome from
AppChat and she is all the way in Australia.

Which is unfortunate because I won't be able
to see her face when I crush her....and she
won. Curse you, Elly!

And then defend yourself in space in this
episodes app of 
the week...
Rymdkapsel. Rymdkapsel is a

real time strategy game boiled down to the
very basics. There are only 3 objectives,

3 resources, one kind of unit to control,
and one kind of enemy to defeat. You can only

build on the brown corridors and, similar
to tetris, the shapes of the rooms you build

are not always the same so you have to be
thoughtful of what you put where. As you command

your tiny white rectangular minions to expand
your space station and explore the galaxy,

you'll uncover monoliths that unlock new abilities.
The game is beautiful and simple in presentation

but incredibly engaging. You'll find yourself
replaying it as you try to build better and
more succinct stations.

Links to all the apps can be found in the
description below.

Check out my friend Elly at AppChat for more
awesome apps and as always, thanks for watching.

Mini Mix Mayhem tests yo gaming skills by
throwing four random mini games at you at

the same time. The games are actually pretty
fun when you can tell what's happening, but

as it progresses, they pop up more quickly
and you'll go through your lives until you
have nun..attack

Nun Attack: Run & Gun is a fun endless runner
that could have had a lot more puns in it's

title, but I'll forgive it because I get to
shoot monsters in the face. As with most endless

runners, the better you do the better gear
you unlock, like weapons that can then be

used to better shoot monsters in the face.
If only they had nun chucks...

Auralux is a RTS game that has you taking
over enemy stars. Each unit starts out with

the same resources so you really do have to
strategize how you are going to conquer each

level. The rounds lasts for awhile which just
adds to how weirdly relaxing the game is.

If you're reading this then help me! I am
trapped inside the computer!

title: Inside Your Heart! -- App All Knight #16
